tweets.text:
High w/end rainfall meant we had to operate Twerton sluice gates to control high flows in Avon.

Both gates were operated successfully using manual controls.

Today we raised the vertical gate slightly to remove trapped debris This went smoothly & the debris successfully removed. https://t.co/H5w3C0wt8u

More good news at #Avonmouth. Yet another fire at @SimsMM those of secret meeting with cllrs and no prosecutions for multiple breaches of the law. No warnings to local residents #CoverdUpAgain @MarvinJRees @EnvAgency https://t.co/cZ7mDhg3fp

We are still in attendance at a large fire in Avonmouth. The smoke from the incident is affecting a large area. Advice is to close all windows and doors and stay inside where possible. @PHE_uk @BristolCouncil @EnvAgencySW @bristolportpol @ASPolice #teamwork

This does not bode well. The @EnvAgency chief @JamesBevanEA says the agency "lacks the powers and resources" to tackle farm pollution. Might've been worth mentioning this a little sooner? 
https://t.co/ufu58O0RI0
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/bNAXQbWW1G

We‚Äôre working with @WTBBC and @BhamCityCouncil on improvements to R.Cole in #Birmingham. Just completed an area through #BordesleyGreen  creating a meander, marginal shelves & in-channel habitat in a straightened section of river. Volunteers to plant shelves with native species https://t.co/MCPO1nVy9O

tweets.text: @PhantasmDog @baza101 @SimsMM @MarvinJRees @EnvAgency The distinction of a COMAH site designation has been contested by #Avonmouth residents for years. Form AqHerb01: Agreement to use herbicides in or near water? https://t.co/9NZVXCmMXN

@Glutenfreescone @SimsMM @MarvinJRees @EnvAgency @sandyhruthven Servernside Sirens Charidee should be alerting residents. @wendybufton @DaveThroupEA @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @Wychavon All that hard work... why didn't you get a couple of beavers to do it?

This weekends rain has put the newly installed leaky woody dams at Charlton to the test & proven very effective at holding back the flood waters #nfm #naturalfloodmanagement #worcestershire #slowtheflow @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @Wychavon https://t.co/Yn7mtqg0SK

@SustainableImp @ChippenhamNow @Chippenhamtcl @WiltsWildlife @EcologyMinded @BristolAvonRT Hi Matthew no we did not follow Wiltshire wildlife report we did not receive a copy from chippenham town council until the 24 sep the work had already been done. We followed HSE and environmental agency guidelines and regulations with a licensed firm
@awliberal @EnvAgency @unitedutilities Checking the figures for 2019 it appears that @unitedutilities spent 254,467 hours dumping sewage into rivers on 63,114 separate occasions.

Hey @EnvAgencySW @EnvAgency if there is a large fire at an industrial site, people are naturally going to worry. I think the people living near @SimsMM deserve to know what is going on. Why no warnings? Why no advice? @BristolLive have you been able to get any information? https://t.co/MOgKiytULv

tweets.text: Although our world shifted with the pandemic, the reasons we marched globally with @GretaThunberg last autumn haven‚Äôt changed. Listen to the most recent episode of our podcast, as Dr. Eugenie Waters & Dr. Sarah Sloan speak about health & climate advocacy. https://t.co/BNKdoe27WS

The #Ponteland #Flood Alleviation Scheme is the first project to benefit from ¬£170m of Government funding. 

This funding advances work on #FloodDefence schemes across the country, which will drive economic growth and protect communities. 

Read more:
https://t.co/opz5RtmFzQ https://t.co/AecfJaWzWI

@RachSalv @GeorgeMonbiot @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA Yes!
How long has this been the case?
Have they had their powers removed recently?
Or
We‚Äôre they always a waste of money and resources?
@RachSalv @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA Perhaps if they weren't hamstrung by flood defence work they could put some effort into environmental regulation and enforcement. Time to split flood work away.

#floodalert #bradfordonavon - River levels peaked overnight & are now steadily falling. Thanks to CEVs Sarah & Ann M for final 09:00hrs report & @EnvAgencySW who are now packing up barriers.
